I agree.

There are barely any avicus teams left and with 8 major teams (Cacal, Berzerk, Apollo, Furium, BC, PPB, Cronus, Fort) some of them barely scrim. The teams I've seen scrimming a lot lately were BC, Berzerk, and Fort. Avicus needs to step up their game on player count q_q

replies.body:
People can't handle losing or just whine a lot. Lol, people seem like they put their pride & egos on the line every scrim, that's the issue. 

General Thoughts:
Who cares? It's just one scrim, you'll get another some other time. Imo, one of the keys to being a good player is try not to stress yourself out or panic, act kinda relaxed. Take the approach of, "Whatever, this is just another game amongst many, but I'll still try my best for my team." and it will benefit people more. No use drowning yourself with the past, why let something so little drag you down? And if you really want to benefit the team, you need to be thinking as clear as possible at all times, which you can't do while salty, frustrated, sad or stressed. I understand passion is a part of every game, but detaching yourself a bit gives you better decision making and strategical thinking overall.
replies.body_tagged:
People can't handle losing or just whine a lot. Lol, people seem like they put their pride & egos on the line every scrim, that's the issue. 

General Thoughts:
Who cares? It's just one scrim, you'll get another some other time. Imo, one of the keys to being a good player is try not to stress yourself out or panic, act kinda relaxed. Take the approach of, "Whatever, this is just another game amongst many, but I'll still try my best for my team." and it will benefit people more. No use drowning yourself with the past, why let something so little drag you down? And if you really want to benefit the team, you need to be thinking as clear as possible at all times, which you can't do while salty, frustrated, sad or stressed. I understand passion is a part of every game, but detaching yourself a bit gives you better decision making and strategical thinking overall.
